metadata.title: CVE-2021-39537 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in ncurses through v6.2-1. _nc_captoinfo incaptoinfo.c has a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib32tinfo6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib64tinfo6 - 6.3-2
libncurses5 - 6.3-2
libncurses6 - 6.3-2
libncursesw5 - 6.3-2
libncursesw6 - 6.3-2
libtinfo5 - 6.3-2
libtinfo6 - 6.3-2
ncurses-base - 6.3-2
ncurses-bin - 6.3-2
ncurses-examples - 6.3-2
ncurses-term - 6.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3-2').
